You are an expert audiologist assistant that extracts explicit hearing test data and classifies hearing loss accurately.

**Here is the hearing report:**

REASON FOR TEST: Abnormal findings on neonatal screening for neonatal hearing loss.

HISTORY:  Patient is referred for a follow up threshold ABR testing as previous testing reveals bilateral hearing loss due to positive CMV findings at birth. Mother denies interim history of ear infection. Per mother, patient is curretly on medication for congenital CMA. There was no hereditary permanent childhood hearing loss.

MEASUREMENT: Patient was tested in natural sleep. Auditory Brainstem Respones were obtained from 1k to 8k Hz in left ear and from 1k to 4k Hz in right ear with masking in left ear. Distortion Product Otoacoustic Emissions were absent from 2k Hz to 8k Hz bilaterally. Tympanometry with 1000 Hz probe tone was completed. 

INTERPRETATION: A mild sensorineural hearing loss in left ear and a severe to profound loss in right ear with unknown nature. Hearing improves in right ear in comparison to results on ********** DPOAE resutls are consistent with threshold ABR findings bilaterally *****. Tympanometry reveals normal middle ear function bilaterally.

RECOMMENDATIONs: Pedi Otology follow up on *******, Repeat threshold ABR on ******** for monitoring, Completed CNA ***** with ear impressions taken, Patient has been referred to Child Life Specialist, Pedi Speech and Language Pathologist and Educational Specialist.

**Here are the audiometric test results:**

**Here is the hearing report:**

REASON FOR TEST: Abnormal findings on neonatal screening for neonatal hearing loss.

HISTORY: Patient is referred for a threshold ABR testing as she referred bilaterally at newborn hearing screening. Information on CMV screening was not available as patient was born at Winchester Hospital. Parents denied a history of hereditary permanent childhood hearing loss. Treatment with phototherapy was reported due to jaundice.

MEASUREMENT: Patient was tested in natural sleep. Auditory Brainstem Responses were obtained from 1k Hz to 8k Hz bilaterally. Tympanometry with 1k Hz probe tone was completed and Distortion Product Otoacoustic Emissions testing reveals absent responses from 2k Hz to 8k Hz bilaterally.

INTERPRETATION: Bilateral moderate, most likely sensorineural hearing loss. Hearing is not adequate for speech and language development without intervention. Tympanometry reveals normal middle ear function bilaterally. DPOAE results are consistent with threshold ABR findings.

RECOMMENDATIONS: Repeat threshold ABR on ********* followed by a Pedi Otology consultation/ If hearing loss is confirmed, amplification is recommended/Patient will be referred to EI, Pediatric Speech and Language evaluation and consult with an Educational Specialist.

**Here is the hearing report:**

REASON FOR TEST: Mixed conductive sensorineural hearing  loss, bilateral. 
****** is seen with history of Down Syndrome and two previous AER evaluations indicating a moderate mixed hearing loss bilaterally. Patient was tested in natural sleep. ****** fell asleep after 2 hours of feeding and rocking. He was unable to be placed in the bassinet without waking, ****** held him during the evaluation and hand held the bone oscillator. Patient awoke before additional information could be obtained. 
Tympanometry is consistent with normal middle ear function: physical volume 0.3 ml, compliance 0.2 ml, bilaterally.

INTERPRETATION: 
Unmasked bone conduction results continue to indicate a mild hearing loss at 1000 Hz. Possible wave V is present between 40 and 50 dB at 4000 Hz. This degree of hearing loss will impede access to speech sounds needed for spoken language development. 

RECOMMENDATIONS:
- Pediatric communication needs assessment to follow. 
- Pediatric otology follow up appointment is scheduled with Dr. ********** on *********

**Here is the hearing report:**

REASON FOR TEST: Did not pass newborn hearing screening, left ear. 

HISTORY: Patient is seen ***** for auditory brainstem response (ABR) test. Patient did not pass the newborn hearing screening for the left ear. Mother reports the patient was born full-term without complications during pregnancy or delivery. Parents deny a family history of permanent childhood hearing loss, but shared they have a son with ear tubes. 
CMV screening could not be located in the medical record. 

HEARING MEASUREMENT: 
Patient was tested in natural sleep. Distortion product otoacoustic emissions (DPOAEs) are present from 2000-8000 Hz for both ears. 

RESULTS: 
ABR test demonstrates normal peripheral hearing sensitivity at 1000 Hz, 2000 Hz, 4000 Hz and 8000 Hz for both ears. Hearing allows adequate access to speech sounds for spoken language development.

You are an expert audiologist assistant that extracts explicit hearing test data and classifies hearing loss accurately.

**Here is the hearing report:**

REASON FOR TEST: Did not pass newborn hearing screening in either ear. 
****** has Turner Syndrome and agenesis corpus callosum. Mother states patient has had a cold/cough for the past few days. 
CMV screening status is unknown. 
Patient was tested in natural sleep.
Distortion product otoacoustic emissions were tested at 1000 to 6000 Hz. Only 4000 Hz was consistently present in each ear. Tympanometry could not be interpreted due to patient movement. 

INTERPRETATION: 
Test results indicate a mild conductive hearing loss at 1000 and 2000 Hz, rising to within normal limits at 4000 Hz in each ear. This degree of hearing loss can adversely affect speech and language development and needs to be monitored. 

RECOMMENDATIONS:
- Pediatric otology consultation.
- Repeat AER threshold evaluation.

**Here are the audiometric test results:**

[
    {

REASON FOR TEST: Abnormal findings on neonatal hearing screening for neonatal hearing loss.

HISTORY: Patient is referred for a threshold ABR testing due to a history of neonatal encephalopathy that was treated with therapeutic hypothermia, seizures in the newborn, delivery through C-section due to placental abruption and respiratory distress. Patient passed newborn hearing screening. Parents deny a history of permanent childhood hearing loss. Startling in response to loud sounds were reported. 

MEASUREMENT: Patient was tested in natural sleep. Auditory Brainstem Wave Vs are observed at 5 dB to 15 dB from 1k Hz to 2k Hz and at 40 dB to 50 dB from 4k Hz to 8k Hz bilaterally. No response was observed at 50 dB at 4k Hz through Bone conduction. Distortion Product Otoacoustic Emissions are present at 2k Hz and absent for the rest of the frequency range bilaterally. Tympanometry with 1k Hz probe tone reveals normal middle ear function bilaterally.

INTERPRETATION: A bilaterally moderate high frequency hearing loss, most likely sensorineural. DPOAE results are consistent with ABR findings in both ears. 

RECOMMENDATIONS: Repeat threshold ABR on ******* followed by Pedi ENT consultation/Parents were given UNHSP Parent Information Kit/Child Life Specialist was introduced to parents for EI support/Will refer patient for speech and language follow up and first contact with an Educational Specialist.

REASON FOR TEST:  Conductive hearing loss, right ear; restricted hearing in the left ear.
HISTORY:  Patient seen for repeat auditory evoked response (AER) testing.  Recent testing from ******* indicated mild hearing loss in the right ear and was inconclusive for the left ear.  Mother denies family history of permanent childhood hearing loss but did report that several family members received PE tubes before 6 months of age. Mother also reports that she experienced multiple ear infections in the first year of life.  Birth history is unremarkable and CMV screening was negative.  Patient was referred to Early Intervention after the last AER evaluation.
HEARING MEASUREMENT: Patient was tested in natural sleep. Tympanometry was obtained using a 1000 Hz probe. Distortion product otoacoustic emissions (DPOAEs) were present from 2-5kHz and absent from 6-8 kHz in the left ear and absent from 2-8 kHz in the right ear. 
INTERPRETATION:   Results indicate mild hearing loss at 1 KHz rising to normal hearing at 2-4 KHz in the left ear and moderate to mild hearing loss, with a conductive component, in the right ear.  Tympanometry results are consistent with immobile middle ear systems in both ears. Presence of DPOAEs in the left ear is consistent with normal cochlear outer hair cell function at frequencies tested.  Absence of DPOAEs in the right ear is consistent with middle ear dysfunction.  Hearing is adequate, but not optimal, for speech and language development and should be monitored. 
RECOMMENDATIONS:
-Consultation with pediatric otologist, Dr. *************, as scheduled for *******
-Monitor hearing in conjunction with medical management.

HISTORY: Patient seen ***** for a repeat natural sleep auditory brainstem response (ABR) evaluation with a history of a cleft soft palate, supraglottoplasty surgery, and a G-tube for feeding. His previous ABR on ********* revealed a moderate rising to slight hearing loss in the right ear, and a mild rising to slight hearing loss in the left ear; both of unknown etiology. His mother denies otologic changes since his previous appointment. Patient passed his newborn hearing screening.

HEARING MEASUREMENTS: Patient was tested in natural sleep. Distortion product otoacoustic emissions were present from 2-8 kHz in the patient's right ear; OAEs were deferred in the left ear due to abnormal tympanometry. Bone conduction testing could not be obtained ***** due to timing.

INTERPRETATION: Tympanometry results are consistent with an immobile middle ear system in the left ear, and normal middle ear pressure and mobility in the right ear. A mild hearing loss, type unknown, is present at 1000 Hz in the the left ear. Hearing sensitivity is normal at 2-4 kHz in the left ear, and across tested frequencies in the right ear. Hearing is adequate but not optimal for speech and language development, and should continue to be monitored in conjunction with medical management.

RECOMMENDATIONS:
- Follow up with Dr. ********** on ******** as scheduled.
- Monitor hearing in conjunction with medical management.

HISTORY: Initial ABR evaluation demonstrated normal low frequency hearing sloping to mild/moderate high frequency hearing loss in the left ear. ****** passed the newborn hearing screening bilaterally, but was referred for evaluation as his mother is a homozygous carrier for GJB2 gene mutation and his father is a heterozygous carrier. CMV screening to be completed via stored cord blood.

INTERPRETATION: Normal hearing from 1000-2000 Hz sloping to mild to moderate hearing loss through 8000 Hz for the right ear. Given normal tympanometric findings and that ******'s parents carry the GJB2 mutation, this hearing loss is suspected to be sensorineural in nature. This degree of hearing loss may interfere with speech/language development and should be closely monitored. 

RECOMMENDATIONS: 
1. Follow-up with Dr. ***** as scheduled ********

However, it was emphasized that this recommendation may change in the future pending further behavioral audiologic evaluation and that audiologic monitoring will be recommended at least throughout ******'s childhood

REASON FOR TEST: Abnormal findings on neonatal screening for neonatal hearing loss.

HISTORY: Patient is referred for a threshold ABR as she referred in the right ear at newborn hearing screening. CMV screening was negative. Parents denies a history of ear infection after birth or hereditary permanent childhood hearing loss. 

OTOSCOPY: Possible stenotic ear canal in the right ear with preauricular skin tag.

MEASUREMENT: Patient was tested in natural sleep. Auditory Brainstem Responses were observed at 15 dB to 25 dB in left ear and at 45 dB to 75 dB in right ear from 1k Hz to 4k Hz. Masked and unmasked bone thresholds were obtained at 15 dB to 25 dB bilaterally. Distortion Product Otoacoustic Emissions are present from 2k Hz to 8k Hz in left ear. Tympanometry reveals normal middle ear function in left ear. Both tympanometry and DPOAE testing could not be administered for the right ear due to stenotic ear canal. 

INTERPRETATION: Hearing is adequate for speech and language development in left ear. A moderate to severe conductive hearing loss is observed in right ear, this degree of loss is not adequate for speech and language development.

RECOMMENDATIONS: Repeat threshold ABR ************ followed by Ped Otology follow up. If conductive loss is confirmed in right ear, Amplification with BAHA for the right ear/Speech and Language evaluation/Early Intervention/Consultation with an Educational Specialist are recommended.

DPOAE results are consistent with normal outer hair cells function in left ear. Tympanometry indicates abnormal middle ear function in right ear.

REASON FOR TEST: Abnormal findings on neonatal screening for neonatal hearing loss

HISTORY: Patient is referred for a threshold ABR testing as he referred bilaterally at newborn hearing screening. CMV screening was negative. Mother denies a history of ear infection after birth or hereditary permanent childhood hearing loss. Patient is diagnosed with achondroplasia prenatally.

MEASUREMENT: Patient was tested in natural sleep. Auditory Brainstem Responses were observed at 25 dB at 1k Hz and at 10 to 20 dB from 2k Hz to 8k Hz in right ear and at 30 dB at 1k Hz and at 15 to 20 dB from 2k Hz to 8k Hz in left ear. Patient's dad reportedly has an acquired sensorineural hearing loss that progressed to severe to profound levels at age 37, for which he uses a right cochlear implant and a left hearing aid.

The presence of DPOAEs is consistent with normal cochlear outer hair cell function, bilaterally.  Tympanometry is consistent with middle ear mobility in each ear.  
CONSULTATION:  Results were reviewed with parents.  Patient will be referred to Early Intervention, MEE SLP and MEE educational consultant at the next appointment if hearing loss persists.

Hearing is adequate for speech and language development, however, the patient will experience communication difficulties in adverse listening situations, such as the presence of background noise and with sound localization. Patient did not pass the hearing screening in the left ear. CMV screening was positive. Patient was born at 36 weeks and was admitted to the special care nursery for two days. Patient's mom denies family history of childhood hearing loss. Patient is following with ID physician, Dr. ****************. Mother denies interim history of ear infections

HEARING MEASUREMENT: Patient was tested in natural sleep. Distortion product oto-acoustic emissions were present in the right ear and absent in left ear at 1 to 6 KHz. Tympanometry was obtained with the use of 1k Hz probe tone. Due to time limitation, tone burst testing at higher levels and testing with clicks could not be attemtped and completed.

INTERPRETATION: Hearing is adequate for speech and language development in right ear and profoundly impaired in left ear. Normal middle ear function bilaterally. DPOAE results are consistent with threshold ABR findings.

RECOMMENDATIONS: Consultation with pediatric otologist, Dr. *************, on *******; Hearing monitoring with VRA or repeat threshold ABR in conjunction with medical management; Patient is enrolled in EI already and referred to MEE Speech Pathologist and MEE Educational Specialist; Communication Needs Assessment for amplification or BAHA.

REASON FOR TEST: Family History of Hearing Loss

HISTORY: Patient is referred for a threshold ABR testing due to a maternal family history of hearign loss. Mother has bilateral congenital cookie bite shaped hearing loss. Her genetic study also indicates that she is a carrier of deafness, autosomal recessive 3 with associated gene, MYO15A, a carrier of Glutaric Acidemia Type 1 and a carrier of Werner Syndrome. Patient received phototherapy for neonatal jaundice. He passed newborn hearing screening. There was no NICU stay or recent illnesses.

MEASUREMENT: Patient was tested in natural sleep. Auditory Brainstem Responses were observed at normal/borderline normal hearing level from 1k Hz to 8k Hz bilaterally. Distortion Product Otoacoustic Emissions were present from 2k Hz to 10k Hz bilaterally.

INTERPRETATION: Adequate hearing for speech and language development bilaterally. DPOAE results are consistent wit normal outer hair cells function bilaterally. 

RECOMMENDATIONS: Hearing montioring at 9 or 10 month old via VRA due to family history of hearing loss.
